column1: this is a csv file read example
column2: the FileReader is configured to readAsArrayBuffer. This will not provide the text content needed for parsing
column3: leading to a crash or incorrect output.

column1: CSV Parsing is Incorrect: The core logic for splitting the CSV text into rows and headers is flawed. It only splits by commas
column3: which will result in all the data appearing as a single malformed row.

column1: App Crashes When No File Is Uploaded: If the component renders initially or if you click "Reset
column2:
it tries to map over tableData.headers, which is undefined. This causes the application to crash.
Table Rows Are Not Rendered Correctly: The parsed rows array will contain strings for each row, but the rendering logic in the tbody only creates one <td> per row, displaying the entire comma-separated string instead of individual cells.
Reset Button Doesn't Clear the Table: Clicking the Reset" button clears the file name
column3: but it doesn't clear the tableData state
column4: leaving the previously rendered table visible.
